questions.question: A point on a wheel with a radius of $2 \text{ m}$ rotates through an angle of $3 \text{ radians}$. What is the arc length ($s$) traveled?
An object moves in a circle of radius $5 \text{ m}$ with a period of $10 \text{ s}$. What is its tangential speed?
A disk rotates at $180 \text{ revolutions per minute (rpm)}$. What is this frequency in Hz?
An object moves through an arc length of $2 \text{ m}$ on a circle with a radius of $0.5 \text{ m}$. What is the angular displacement in radians?
A wheel with a $0.5 \text{ m}$ radius has a tangential speed of $10 \text{ m/s}$. What is its angular speed ($\omega$)?
If an object takes $2 \text{ seconds}$ to move $90^\circ$ around a circle, what is its period?
questions.explanation: $90^\circ$ is 1/4 of a circle, so period = $4 \times 2 = 8$ s.

questions.question: A runner on a $50 \text{ m}$ radius circular track has a tangential speed of $5 \text{ m/s}$. How long does it take to complete one lap (the period)?
A point on the rim of a disk with radius 0.3 meters moves through an arc length of 0.75 meters. What is the angular displacement in radians?
An object in uniform circular motion has a tangential speed of 12 meters per second and a period of 2.5 seconds. What is the radius of its circular path?

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered circular motion calculations.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review the relationships between $s = r\theta$, $v = r\omega$, and $v = 2\pi r/T$.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on converting between degrees and radians.
scoreMessages.0: Let's review. Study the fundamental formulas for arc length, angular displacement, and tangential speed.
